title-group.article-title: From Encounter to Creation: The Genesis of Metaphor in "A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man"

abstract.p: Metaphorics, the movement and process of metaphor, is distributed in Joyce's A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man as modes generating meaning in each of the novel's five chapters. Each of these modes is linked with the specific "historical" matrix in which it originates, a site which determines the metaphor's structure, its function, and the stylistic effects it produces.
